node.title: Kiwi rowing great Hamish Bond announces retirement
node.description: Bond is the first male New Zealander to win three successive Olympic gold medals.
node.content: ["Kiwi rowing great Hamish Bond has announced his retirement from the sport.", "The three-time Olympic champion leaves rowing as one of New Zealand\u2019s most decorated athletes and Olympians, having won gold in rowing coxless pair with crewmate Eric Murray at both the London 2012 and Rio 2016 Olympic Games, before leading the men\u2019s eight crew to gold at Tokyo 2020.", "He is the first male New Zealander to win three successive Olympic gold medals. Bond is also an eight-time world champion.", "The 35-year-old says he\u2019s known for a while that it was the right time for him to hang up the oars.", "\"It does feel strange saying that I\u2019m retiring but I feel very fortunate to be walking away while at the top of the sport,\" said Bond.", "\"Rowing for the bulk of my career has defined me as a person, I now have my family and other priorities and it feels like the right move to make\".", "More to come", "\u00a0"]
